message: Introduction to Operating Systems Kernels by Eng. KarimAllah Ahmed (Linux Kernel Developer at Amazon Web Services)
story: Ahmad El-Melegy shared CAT Reloaded's event to the group: Egyptian Geeks.

38.name: CAT Hangouts | Introduction to Operating Systems Kernels

name: CAT Hangouts | Introduction to Operating Systems Kernels
caption: CAT Hangouts | Introduction to Operating Systems Kernels
description:
This is an introduction to Operating Systems Kernels, a subject that is usually given as a part of a normal CS curriculum. 

Goals of Hangout :
===============
1- Give a good introduction to "Operating System Kernels"
2- Encourage people to pay more attention to the theoretical foundations of programming.

Contents :
========
1-  Your Swiss knife:
-- Solid hardware knowledge (mastery of at least one architecture, x86 for example).
-- Solid computer science background.
-- Fluency with Linux tool-chains (usually GCC).
-- Fluency in a system's language (usually c (or c++ ) + assembly)

2- Bootstrapping stage.

3- Operating systems anatomy.
-- Applications.
-- Libraries.
-- Kernel.

4- A closer look into *monolithic* kernels (more on *monolithic* later)
-- User/Kernel boundary a.k.a system calls.
-- Memory Management.
-- VFS ( file systems ).
-- Process management ( page-tables ).
-- IO.

5- Different approaches to kernel design (monolithic, micro-kernel, etc).

6- Demo time:
-- Using QEMU for developing our own kernel.

Table of contents on workflowy : https://workflowy.com/s/cO8WqWg9XT

Speaker :
========
Eng. KarimAllah Ahmed

- Linux Kernel Developer at Amazon Web Services 
Software engineer with a decent background in Linux/Unix administration.

- Fluent in several programming languages, and well-versed in several programming paradigms. 

- His main areas of expertise are Kernel Design, Virtualization, and Microprocessors.

Linkendin: http://de.linkedin.com/pub/karimallah-ahmed/13/829/550
